Posts.Content: May 11, 2009 10:51AM Barbara4122 wrote: My best friends Mom found breast ca last year...did not need chemo but did have surgery and radiation.  She is in her 80's and is doing great.  Granted, she was not frail to begin with but still does not look worse for the wear.

Posts.Content: May 22, 2009 10:07AM Barbara4122 wrote: Hi Bizzlin, Yes, I still could use reassurance...I am glad you got back positive feedback.  I know Dr Wu is very interested in the latest breast recon trends...she is young and very talented.  She has a great resume so I am not afraid to trust her skills.  Salzberg was new at this once too I guess! I know Dr Sabol, the breast surgeon, is very skilled and I love her personality. Dr Wu is not the touchy, feely, nuruturing type but I am looking for talent and skill here!  She is certainly pleasant enough and that's good enough. (ps-where did you put our feelers, patients or other docs?).

Posts.Content: May 21, 2009 05:15AM Barbara4122 wrote: Hi bizzlin, I think Dr Wu has only done a handful of these.  I do trust her talent though. I am still deciding if I want direct to implant or expanders as direct to implant is a little more limited in size avail.  Drs Salzberg and Ashikari are very well known and many women rave about them.  I was going to go for a consult but I didn't want to be that far from home and I would most likely have had to pay several thousand out of pocket.   What PS office did you meet these women at?  Did they have direct to implant w\alloderm? Barbara
Posts.Title: Nipple Sparing Alloderm w/Implant Breast Reconstruction brynze clemmons64

Posts.Content: May 20, 2009 04:07PM Barbara4122 wrote: blizzlin, Dr Jennifer Sabol at Lankenau will do nipple sparing if you are a good candidate.  She is doing mine on June 16th.  My PS is Dr Liza Wu from Penn, she and Dr Serletti (also from Penn) also work out of Lankenau.  I have heard recently that Dr Marcia Boraas at Penn MAY do nipple sparing when appropriate, though she is very recently on board with this.  I really do like Dr Sabol so I will stay with her.  Dr Wu is going to attempt a direct to implant with Alloderm for me but if she cannot put at least 500 cc without concern then I will have expanders. My surgery is prophylactic (BRCA1+) so I guess they are more comfortable doing nipple sparing. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Nipple Sparing Alloderm w/Implant Breast Reconstruction brynze clemmons64

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2009 10:43PM Barbara4122 wrote: Angel, sorry for your setbacks but looks like things are okay now.  Can you tell me how you knew you had cellulitis?  I had nipple sparing PBM and there is a 1mm (small) red spot on my right aerola. This nipple took beating and took longer to heal than the left. Of course it does not hurt but it seems a little bit redder since the last fill...I hope that is not cellulitis.  Wow, 150cc fills!!! I have been having 60cc's and I that is a little taxing. Good luck with your exchange surgery on Aug 17th.
